pull.title: test: make the node param explicit in init_wallet()
pull.body: This PR changes the definition of `def init_wallet(self, i)` to `def init_wallet(self, *, node)` to make the node parameter explicit, as suggested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22794#discussion_r713287448 .

events.message: Make explicit the node param in init_wallet()

rename.from: Make the node param explicit in init_wallet()
rename.to: test: make the node param explicit in init_wallet()

issue.title: test: Verify if wallet is compiled in rpc_invalid_address_message.py test
issue.body:
Most of  `test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py` does not requires wallet.
But if the project is compiled in disable-wallet mode, the entire test will be skipped.


This PR changes the test to run the RPC tests first and then checks if the wallet is compiled.

events.body:
tested ACK 7b3c9e4.

This is a nice change! The function call `self.init_wallet(node=0)` is more understandable compared to `self.init_wallet(0)`. This call format is also consistent with other functions from the codebase like [test_cltv_info](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/c8e68b418fcb62e853214e0a0df8bb860c38699c/test/functional/feature_cltv.py#L93) and [test_dersig_info](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/c8e68b418fcb62e853214e0a0df8bb860c38699c/test/functional/feature_dersig.py#L62) which are defined in a similar manner. Verified that there arenâ€™t other instances making the `init_wallet()` call.

issue.title: test: follow up for #23316
issue.body: This PR addresses [#23316(review)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23316#discussion_r732937984) and uses a for loop to make `init_wallet()` calls in `test/functional/wallet_backup.py`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -124,9 +124,9 @@ def restore_wallet_existent_name(self):
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Wallet name already exists.", node.restorewallet, wallet_name, wallet_file)
 
     def init_three(self):
-        self.init_wallet(0)
-        self.init_wallet(1)
-        self.init_wallet(2)
+        self.init_wallet(node=0)
+        self.init_wallet(node=1)
+        self.init_wallet(node=2)
comments.body:
```diff
     def init_three(self):
-        self.init_wallet(node=0)
-        self.init_wallet(node=1)
-        self.init_wallet(node=2)
+        for n in range(3):
+            self.init_wallet(node=n)
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -124,9 +124,9 @@ def restore_wallet_existent_name(self):
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Wallet name already exists.", node.restorewallet, wallet_name, wallet_file)
 
     def init_three(self):
-        self.init_wallet(0)
-        self.init_wallet(1)
-        self.init_wallet(2)
+        self.init_wallet(node=0)
+        self.init_wallet(node=1)
+        self.init_wallet(node=2)
